pr_title: HDDS-2927. Cache EndPoint tasks instead of creating them all the time in RunningDatanodeState

timeline.message: HDDS-2927. Cache EndPoint tasks instead of creating them all the time.
HDDS-2927. Cache EndPoint tasks instead of creating them all the time.

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this be state instead of endpoint.getState()?  Assuming the endpoint state is constant during initialization, wouldn't this create several instances of the same type (eg. RegisterEndpointTask) for each endpoint?
timeline.author: adoroszlai

replies.bodyText: Yes, it should be state, it's my typo. Here we will create endpoint task for each state type.
replies.author: linyiqun

timeline.bodyText: Nit: no need to store null task for shutdown state.
timeline.author: adoroszlai

timeline.bodyText: Nit: EnumMap is better suited for maps keyed by enums.
timeline.author: adoroszlai

timeline.bodyText: Can you please explain why a string-based map is better than using the endpoint itself as a key?
timeline.author: adoroszlai

replies.bodyText: I just wan to use a more simple identity to indicate the different  Endpoint instance. So I use the endpoint address. But I have updated this to use Endpoint itself now.
replies.author: linyiqun
